model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I'm pretty excited! They just added one of my favorite dishes to the menu at work. I can't wait for my next shift so I can try it for free. I will send you a pic later, ok? 

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Speaker B is a music lover who enjoys old bands like Styx and Journey. They have a close relationship with their grandchildren, who sometimes fight with each other. Speaker B also loves the beach and Mediterranean food. 

Relationship Description:
The relationship between Speaker B and Speaker A seems casual and friendly, with Speaker B showing interest in Speaker A's work schedule and enjoying conversations about concerts and music preferences.

Event Description:
Speaker A had a fire incident at the restaurant but managed to put it out, feeling scared during the incident. Speaker A expressed a lot of responsibility in such moments. Speaker B attended an Aerosmith concert and was impressed by the performance. Speaker A also mentioned going to a concert this week and wanting to go rock climbing with Speaker B. Speaker B asked about free meals at the restaurant where Speaker A works and found it to be a great perk. Speaker A prefers the free meals over just a discount. Speaker A enjoys working at the restaurant and interacting with people.
